intro: Banisteria floribunda, commonly known as the red moringa or red mombin, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are also edible and have been utilized in various culinary and medicinal practices. Banisteria floribunda is known for its adaptability to a range of soil types and its ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
